intro: Pleurothallis roezlii, commonly known as the Roëzli's orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate flowers. The plant typically features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
